alert.note: Alert for Vanderburgh (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 4:59AM EDT until August 26 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR VANDERBURGH AND CENTRAL HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 359 AM CDT, Radar estimates and rain gauge totals report up to 2 inches of rain has fallen since 2 am in parts of Vanderburgh and Henderson Counties. Street flooding has been reported in Evansville. Another area of moderate to heavy rain is moving in from the west and may lead to additional heavy rainfall and exacerbate ongoing flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Henderson, Newburgh, Melody Hill, Kasson and Hebbardsville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
